original: ISBERG, Sten Johan, Sjökapten, Göteborg, f Sköllersta, öbr l, 18/10 76 av rekt P I o Eva Sandström, gm Inez Helander. Tekn sk, sjö-kaptex, resoffex v fi, studieres t utl. Off fi stn Sthlm 03—06, fartygsbef.h 06—07, ch Sv allm sjöförsäkr.AB hav.avd 07—20, vkst dir Gbg frihamns AB 20—43. Sekr Sv sällsk f räddn av skeppsbrutna 08—41. Styr.led i detta samt Gbgs frihamns AB. Resor samtl världsdel o fi eur länd. RNO, RVO, RDDO, RFinlVROlkl, Sv o Da räddnM, NMM, Sv sällsk f räddn av skeppsbr hed.bäg o plakett.
translated: ISBERG, Sten Johan, Ship Captain, Gothenburg, b. Sköllersta, central Sweden, 18/10 1876, son of Principal I and Eva Sandström, m. Inez Helander. Technical school, ship captain examination, reserve officer examination in the army, studied abroad. Military officer in Stockholm 1903-1906, ship captain from 1906-1907, chief of the Marine Department at the Swedish General Maritime Insurance Company from 1907-1920, managing director of the Gothenburg Free Port Company from 1920-1943. Secretary of the Swedish Society for the Rescue of Shipwrecked 1908-1941. Board member of the Swedish Society for the Rescue of Shipwrecked and the Gothenburg Free Port Company. Traveled to all continents and most countries in Europe. Recipient of the Royal Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, Royal Order of Dannebrog, Royal Norwegian Order of Merit, Finnish Order of the White Rose, Swedish and Danish Society for the Rescue of Shipwrecked Medals, and the Swedish Society for the Rescue of Shipwrecked Honorary Goblet and Plaque.
